sources.title: Ring Around the Moon
sources.description: “A superior movie” “Donald Cook showcase” (IMDB reviews quotes). A compact Depression era romantic drama with a strong cast, sharp dialog, crisp direction and good production values for type. A lot of plot from two story lines is skillfully shoehorned into less than 70 minutes. Good print too. So what’s not to like? IMDB rating 6.4. Directed by Charles Lamont. Released in 1936. Complete print.

sources.title: Ring Around the Moon (1936) ROMANCE
sources.description:
Stars: Donald Cook, Erin O'Brien-Moore, Ann Doran
Director: Charles Lamont

A romantically confused news reporter is caught between the contrasting love affairs of a wealthy debutante and a working-class girl. Co-stars Ann Doran, best remembered as James Dean's mother in Rebel Without a Cause.

metadata.Plot: (1936, Chesterfield) Donald Cook, Ann Doran, Erin Moore, Doug Fowley. Cook is a high-flying newspaperman who falls into an engagement to a lady he does not love. Lots of poverty row intrigue follows. Pretty much a straight drama with no real crime elements, but after all, it is a Chesterfield. Doran's first big role. 16mm.
metadata.Writer: Vera Hobart, Vere Hobart, Paul Perez
metadata.Actors: Donald Cook, Erin O'Brien-Moore, Alan Edwards
